articles.title: Federal judge determines Luigi Mangione will not face death penalty
articles.summary: A federal judge has tossed two of the federal government's charges against the man accused of murdering a prominent insurance executive, meaning he will no longer face the death penalty.

articles.title: Op-ed: CMS has the opportunity to improve public health data reporting
articles.summary: The time has come for CMS to implement performance measures—or quantitative metrics—for public health and clinical data exchange, writes Sheri Doyle of The Pew Charitable Trusts.

articles.title: Fierce Healthcare Layoff Tracker—Unite Us reduces workforce; Horizon BCBS cuts 242 jobs
articles.summary: Stick with this tracker for the latest layoff and workforce updates from across healthcare.

articles.title: CMS issues final rule closing state Medicaid provider tax 'loophole'
articles.summary: Restrictions on "a Medicaid financing gimmick” through which states are able to secure greater funding from the federal government was targeted by the agency, budget hawks and Republican lawmakers during 2025, and has now been finalized.

articles.title: Labor Department proposes rule to force greater PBM transparency
articles.summary: The Department of Labor has issued a proposed rule that aims to inject additional transparency in pharmacy benefit manager relationships.

articles.title: Nourish to offer free lab testing for members to inform nutrition care
articles.summary: Nourish Labs will integrate blood testing into personalized nutrition care. The objective measurement will improve treatment plans and strengthen patient engagement, executives say.

articles.title: Maven Clinic launches research institute focused on digital health, collaboration
articles.summary: The institute will serve as a platform for partnerships across academia and industry while expanding the scope of women’s and family health research, Maven Clinic says.

articles.title: Trump administration wants to reward hospitals that buy US-produced medical supplies
articles.summary: A potential "Secure American Medical Supplies" designation and accompanying new payment streams for Medicare hospitals would improve emergency preparedness while promoting U.S.

articles.title: Senate Democrats strike deal with White House to keep government funded: media reports
articles.summary: Legislation that includes funding for HHS and Medicare telehealth extensions is now in peril as Senate Democrats hardened their stance on Department of Homeland Security funding.

articles.title: More than 75 health systems call for stepped-up oversight of patient data sharing
articles.summary: More than 75 health systems sent a letter to federal officials raising concerns about the integrity of nationwide data sharing networks, flagging issues with "bad actors" gaining access to patients' medical information.

articles.title: KFF: Nearly 53M prior auth requests submitted in Medicare Advantage in 2024
articles.summary: A new study shows that close to 53 million prior authorization requests were sent to Medicare Advantage plans in 2024, increasing from 2023 and far above the number required in traditional Medicare.

articles.title: Hims & Hers uses another Super Bowl ad to tackle healthcare affordability
articles.summary: The minute-long ad, which debuted online Thursday ahead of its broadcast premiere during the Feb. 8 game, starts with a stark claim: “Rich people live longer,” said by the ad’s narrator, the rapper and actor Common.

articles.title: About 23M have signed up for ACA coverage so far: CMS
articles.summary: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services has released new data on the Affordable Care Act's open enrollment period, with sign-ups lagging the same timeframe last year.

articles.title: Pennsylvania health department clears CHS' 3-hospital sale to nonprofit
articles.summary: Community Health Systems and Tenor Health Foundation signed a definitive agreement regarding the transfer of Commonwealth Health in October. A prior deal to divest the three-hospital system to another nonprofit had fallen through last year.

articles.title: 10 Medicaid vendors pledge $600M in discounted, free services to support work requirements, CMS says
articles.summary: As states gear up to implement Medicaid work requirements nationally at the start of next year, the Trump administration announced Thursday that 10 leading tech companies have promised to offer $600 million in discounted and free services to support the rollout.

articles.title: Spring Health to buy Alma as AI rapidly reshapes mental healthcare market
articles.summary: Spring Health, a company that offers digital mental healthcare and navigation services, plans to acquire Alma to expand its reach and tap into the the company's roster of health plan partners.

articles.title: CenterWell adopts AI-native athenaOne platform as it expands senior-focused primary care clinics
articles.summary: CenterWell, Humana's senior-focused primary care division, has implemented athenahealth's fully integrated electronic health record with a suite of AI tools across its primary care clinic network.

articles.title: Advocate Health plans $776M increase in total employee compensation for 2026
articles.summary: The country's third-largest nonprofit system, with 167,000 employees and $38 billion in annual revenue, said "competitive" workforce investments like an increased starting minimum wage will benefit both staff and patients.

articles.title: ProMedica signs on with Nomi Health for direct employer contracting
articles.summary: Nomi Health is teaming with Toledo-based ProMedica for the latest expansion of its direct network.

articles.title: Sword Health buys Kaia Health in $285M deal to expand its footprint in US, Germany
articles.summary: Sword Health, a company that provides an AI-first care model, plans to acquire rival Kaia Health for $285 million, the company announced Wednesday.

articles.title: Elevance Health sets 'prudent' 2026 guidance as it navigates ongoing cost, utilization pressures
articles.summary: Elevance Health beat the Street on profit in the fourth quarter of 2025, though a revenue miss generated mixed results.

articles.title: Akido Labs, partners launch AI-powered street medicine program in Bay Area
articles.summary: Akido’s AI-driven platform, ScopeAI, will bolster the capacity of street medicine teams with the goal of keeping unhoused patients healthy and out of hospitals. Several community partners are supporting the program: Future Communities Institute (FCI), Five Keys and Reimagine Freedom.

articles.title: American Academy of Pediatrics' updated immunization schedule rebukes CDC's drastic cutbacks
articles.summary: The pediatric medical group recommends children be vaccinated against 18 diseases, as opposed to the federal government's recent reduction to 11.

articles.title: Employer-focused primary care companies Premise Health, Crossover Health announce merger plans
articles.summary: Premise Health and Crossover Health plan to merge, creating a large employer-focused advanced primary care company serving more than 400 organizations and operating 900 clinics across the country.

articles.title: At-home testing company Reperio teams up with Amazon One Medical on preventive care
articles.summary: This marks Amazon's first partnership in the at-home preventive screening space. Reperio was founded in 2020, working with employers to offer at-home health screenings with instant results.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence, Health Spending, And More
articles.summary: Health Affairs, Volume 45, Issue 1, Page 5-5, January 2026.

articles.title: The AI Arms Race In Health Insurance Utilization Review: Promises Of Efficiency And Risks Of Supercharged Flaws
articles.summary: Health Affairs, Volume 45, Issue 1, Page 6-13, January 2026.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence Payment Policies: Challenges For CMS And The Medicare Physician Fee Schedule
articles.summary: Health Affairs, Volume 45, Issue 1, Page 14-21, January 2026.

articles.title: Aligning AI Payment Policy With Desired Outcomes Rather Than Inputs May Require Customized Pathways
articles.summary: Health Affairs, Volume 45, Issue 1, Page 22-25, January 2026.

articles.title: Medicare Spending On Artificial Intelligence: Payment Policy Is Only Part Of The Story
articles.summary: Health Affairs, Volume 45, Issue 1, Page 26-28, January 2026.
